content:
Hey guys, I was workin on emulation of the real Zulip experience in some way, just to evaluate how colors/headers work while scrolling.
This is a wild draft, which I didn't calibrate even on myself 100%! And I'm making a horrible attempt to evaluate many things in a single picture.

Here is the video instruction on how to use the prototype (you really should watch the video first)

Things to give feedback on:

  • message mouse hover which is not only an appearance of icons but also a darker background
  • color of a user mention button
  • highlight of a message with "you" mentioned
  • color of a group mention button
  • highlight of a message with "your" group mentioned
  • dark 2px unread message marker
  • grey 2px selection box
  • headers of topics, are they distinctive enough? How is the slight tint of color working for you?
  • color of PM's

@Alya Abbott I'll create blue marker and blue selection box later, after people (including us) evaluate this version.

Structural feedback is highly appreciated. As I said, it's a very rough version, which should signalize obvious "no gos". And by having feedback at that stage I'm trying to increase the calibration.
Don't forget to make prototype being 100% of a scale: image.png

Vlad Korobov It's amazing being able to interact with the prototype like this! I need to spend more time with it, but a few initial thoughts:

  • For PMs, I wonder if the background is not quite neutral/subtle enough. I think we want it to feel really non-invasive, since it's behind every message as you're reading it.
  • The paradigm where mentions that include yourself are bolded and mention color matches background color for messages where you are mentioned makes sense to me.
  • Since mentions of other people come up pretty often, I wonder if the purple would be too attention-grabbing? I guess we could try a greyer purple, or a blue -- or perhaps you have other ideas. All else being equal, it could be nice to have @-mentions use brand colors, so if we make individual mentions blue-ish, maybe more rare group mentions can be purplish.
The hover effect feels nice to me. I can find it, but it didn't feel distracting as I was scrolling around.
I think I'm finding the dark unread marker line too gloomy/formal. :)
The subtle stream colors in the message header bar are a cool idea.
overall I think that's really good color balance
Now after I've set with it with a bright screen and with a fresh eye... I'm dimming colors for mentions.
I want to make the selection box "gentle"
you could make it thinner...
6 minutes video update where you should do x1.5 speed and the same prototype is updated
Updated with Mentions link working and showing how colors would work there + couple of little details: image.png
also scrollable
@Alya Abbott
I want to encourage folks to play with this -- it's really cool to see the prototype in action!
This prototype is cool cool!

Updated prototype. Here is the video walkthrough (sorry for the sound). Where I'm covering little things about the implementation.
Here is the prototype to click through
Can't wait to see this live.

Playing around with the hover effect, how should it be have at the top/bottom of a message block? The gap between the hover shading and the message bar/bottom of the box looks a bit funny to me.

Screen-Shot-2022-02-11-at-3.36.11-PM.png
Oh, I think it goes all the way up to the edge on some screens? Anyway, that looks better to me.

I don't think the date lines in the mockup are really working for me; somehow it's a little hard to read the two words right on top of each other, and I'm not unhappy with our current date line design.

How do we reason about the color choices for PMs and mentions? The current direction seems reasonable, but I'm curious if there is some systematic reasoning, or if it's more based on intuition? If there are other color combinations you think could work, it would be interesting to see some mock-ups (still is fine) just to be able to compare some options and feel more confident for making a decision.
Would you like feedback on the left sidebar at this point, or not yet?
How are you thinking about whether the color of the "blue box" and the unread bar should be the same or different?
@Alya Abbott many good questions. Let me answer them one by one

Oh, I think it goes all the way up to the edge on some screens? Anyway, that looks better to me.

I talked about that issue in the video.
So we have situation when we have to decide a little graphical tradeoff.

  1. We can decide to not have paddings between the edge of a topic card and 1 and last messages. In this case we will have situation like this: image.png

  2. Or we might have padding between the edge of a card and first/last message: image.png
    But in some situations we would still have 1. This approach isn't working great in mentions, where we have colored backgrounds:
    image.png
    So we might have approach 1 for such screens:
    image.png
    Yet for hovers we still might see a white background.

I'm ok with both. Ad just wanted to illustrate this nuance. I see it caught your attention, so maybe having focus box tight with an edge is ok.
You might suggest having the selection box which 1px or 2px contracted, but in this case it too tight and we would be forced to increase inner vertical paddings of the message by that amount. This by itself isn't bad by I was afraid that it would be too much of a white space between messages

Alya Abbott said:

I don't think the date lines in the mockup are really working for me; somehow it's a little hard to read the two words right on top of each other, and I'm not unhappy with our current date line design.

I'm very unhappy with the current one, because I'm every time stumbling on it and have a hard time to parse. The advantage of the current one is that it's subtle. And I would be ok if only the following day would be on that line.

Slack has a nice approach of sticking the previous day to the top: image.png

But we kind of already have a sticked day to the top: image.png

I guess we can have 3 in between dates so the top would show the earliest.
So can we just have a single day on a line while having the earliest day sticked to the top right?

How do we reason about the color choices for PMs and mentions?

Calm violet - kind of branding color (we use it also for icons).
image.png

This is about a person. It/s colorful, but not that vibrant as blue, also blue is a focus color and we don't want to mix them. Text buttons are also of that color: image.png.

Violet+ and bold label is when you see your mention. Just a bit brighter that calm purple so you would be happy when you see your name:
image.png

Since you can be mentioned in all kinds of contexts this violet background is contrast enough even when its close to other very light colors (we don't want a user to miss the mention)

Aquamarine (bluish green) for group mentions
As I understood we can distinguish group mention from user mention. So it's nice to have a group highlighted differently, potentially not that strongly as user. So "calm Aquamarine" here is close to user mention but different.
image.png

Aquamarine+ and bold label to highlight group mentions in which you are in. The distinctiveness of the background color is already proven by current PMs
image.png

PMs should be different from mentions and I think the nature of PMs should be a bit warmer. So I tried a warmer color for them. It is still close to grey, but its just a warm grey :smile:
image.png

Alya Abbott said:

Would you like feedback on the left sidebar at this point, or not yet?

Sure, but I didn't do anything new to the left side bar here and I already showed it in another topic in the past. If you have an idea or a new kind of feedback about it and don't want to search for the previous conversation just send it to me in PM please

Alya Abbott said:

How are you thinking about whether the color of the "blue box" and the unread bar should be the same or different?

They are the same tint of color, but different strength/lightness. I don't think that they should be exactly the same at all times.
Unread should be clear strong mark. But selection box is always in your eyes, to it should be less strong to not annoy a user.
@Vlad Korobov absolutely loving the prototype! The design is clean and intuitive and eliminates much of the visual noise we have in the current one. Can't wait to play with it in the CZO deploy.
Absolutely loved the new prototype Vlad Korobov !!

You might suggest having the selection box which 1px or 2px contracted, but in this case it too tight and we would be forced to increase inner vertical paddings of the message by that amount. This by itself isn't bad by I was afraid that it would be too much of a white space between messages

I'd be curious to see what this looks like.

FWIW, a user commented the other day that they like that Zulip is colorful and doesn't feel too "enterprisy". (I think the current design direction preserves the positive aspects of how we use color.)
